metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10229 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
udp.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5 allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code via UDP traffic that triggers an unsafe second checksumcalculation during execution of a recv system call with the MSG_PEEK flag.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10229` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-79.123
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-79.123').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
